items.title: Live: Labor 'really close' to deal on hate speech reforms: Burke
items.description: A deal with the Coalition to pass the government's hate speech reforms is "really close" to being reached, Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says. Follow live.

items.title: The eerie calm over global stocks may be about to shatter
items.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

items.title: Morocco accepts Trump's invite to 'peace' board as Putin yet to decide
items.description: Morocco's King Mohammed VI is the latest leader to accept an invitation to join US President Donald Trump's so-called "Board of Peace", as Russian President Vladimir Putin weighs up his invitation.

items.title: China's birth rate has hit a record low. Experts say it spells long-term trouble
items.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrank by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

items.title: Chinese Christians defiant in face of renewed official crackdown
items.description: Dozens of church leaders and members have been arrested in China in recent months, which advocates say is indicative of intensifying persecution.

items.title: Dissecting Donald Trump's text to Norway's prime minister
items.description: President Donald Trump has sent a text message to Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre saying he "no longer [feels] an obligation to think purely of Peace" after being denied the Nobel Peace Prize. We've analysed the rest of the US president's claims to see if they stack up.

items.title: Women's football captain departs club over offensive 'Silly Saturday' costumes
items.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

items.title: 'There’ll be more': Shark warning after three attacks in Sydney in 26 hours
items.description: A public policy shark expert says sewage leaking into the harbour after heavy rainfall is attracting bait fish followed by sharks.

items.title: First Nations woman asked about eating ants takes department to court
items.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

items.title: Popyrin says he 'can't keep going on like this' after crushing defeat
items.description: Alexei Popyrin concedes he will look inwards once again to think about his career after a crushing loss sent him out of the Australian Open in the first round.

items.title: 12yo girl and two others dead after fiery late-night ute crash
items.description: Police believe two large utes, a Dodge Ram and Ford Ranger, collided on the Bunya Highway at Taabinga, about 200 kilometres north-west of Brisbane.

items.title: Call that likely saved deputy mayor's life almost went unanswered
items.description: A mayor's split-second decision to answer a phone call instead of heading into the surf may well have saved the life of his deputy.

items.title: Live: ASX to open in the red, as gold and silver surge to new highs
items.description: The ASX is set to open lower as safe haven assets surge amid global uncertainty. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Swimmers urged to check pollution in Port Phillip before diving in
items.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

items.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93 in Rome
items.description: The fashion icon's creations were adored by Hollywood stars, royals and first ladies for his fail-safe red carpet designs.

items.title: What we know so far about Spain's fatal high-speed train crash
items.description: Spanish authorities have declared three days of mourning after two trains collided on a track south of Madrid, killing at least 40 people.

items.title: Two charged with attempted murder, firearm recovered after Adelaide shooting
items.description: A man and a woman are expected to face court after each was charged with two counts of attempted murder over a shooting at a Huntfield Heights home that left two people in hospital, police say.

items.title: I was convinced I wasn't sporty. Now I powerlift for Australia
items.description: As a child, Julie "wasn't one of the sporty kids". A safe gym environment and then a supportive powerlifting community helped her realise that wasn't actually true.

items.title: AI fish passage results 'promising' but can it stop another ecological disaster?
items.description: The $6.5 million Menindee fish passage trial is now in year two and results are "promising", but not everyone is buoyed by confidence in the project's ability to prevent another mass fish kill.

items.title: Groundwater drying up as blistering Pilbara heatwave continues
items.description: Water sources are depleting in the Pilbara as the arid region endures a summer with little rainfall and temperatures close to 50C.

items.title: 'Evil and sick': Bondi shooting survivor speaks out after losing his father
items.description: Ya'akov Tetleroyd's father died in the Bondi Beach shootings. He nearly lost his arm as a result of being shot, yet he told 7.30 in an exclusive interview that he forgives the gunmen.

items.title: Australia's 'ghost nets' program expands to heavily fished northern seas
items.description: A $25 million funding injection will help expand the Top End's war on ghost nets, as ranger groups shift focus to the heavily fished seas to Australia's north.

items.title: Zempilas hopes fishing ban can take bite out of WA government's dominance
items.description: While many West Australians were competing for parking spots at beaches on their holidays, Basil Zempilas latched onto two hot topics on which to challenge the government — the demersal fishing ban and WA's illicit tobacco trade.

items.title: Man found dead in back of car near Corowa hospital
items.description: A police investigation is underway after a man was found dead inside a car near a hospital on the NSW–Victoria border.

items.title: Starlink able to help Iranians in 'digital prison', but its monopoly poses a risk
items.description: In Iran, Starlink has provided a line to the outside world, but now there are fears about such vital technology being in the hands of one company.
